intro: Mitesia divergens, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves and stems adapted to salt spray and sandy soils. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found along shorelines and in coastal forests. Mitesia divergens is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
